example.eg: He looked to his right.
example.egtrans: 他往右边看了看。

example.eg: Let me look to see if there is a water leak.
example.egtrans: 让我看看有没有地方漏水。

example.eg: Look at me when I'm talking to you!
example.egtrans: 我在跟你说的话的时候，请看着我！

example.eg: James looked tired when he arrived last night.
example.egtrans: 他昨晚到的时候看上去很累的样子。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看上去, 看起来, 显得

example.eg: Marina looks awful in that outfit.
example.egtrans: 那套衣服让玛丽娜显得很难看。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看上去, 看起来, 显得

example.eg: Look, I've had enough of your insolence; do as you're told!
example.egtrans: 喂，我受够了你的傲慢无礼。别人怎么说，你就怎么做！

example.eg: The blonde girl noticed Dan's look and returned it.
example.egtrans: 那位金发女孩注意到了丹的目光，又把手里的东西放了回去。

example.eg: She silenced him with an angry look.
example.egtrans: 她瞪了他一眼，他不说话了。

example.eg: Zara had no chance of a look at the text before the exam.
example.egtrans: 扎拉没有机会在考试前看一眼课本。

example.eg: The children's toy had the look of a real phone.
example.egtrans: 孩子们的玩具电话样子很像真的电话机。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 表面, 形状, 形状

example.eg: The child's look was starting to make Josh feel very uncomfortable.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 端详, 注视, 凝视

example.eg: I like her look;  it is part urban, part punk.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢她的着装风格，有点都市感，又有些朋克风。

example.eg: Joe is a handsome guy, but he uses his looks to get what he wants.
Richard was looking to find a job at the local factory.
example.egtrans: 理查德想要在当地工厂找到一份工作。

example.eg: This house has five windows that look to the street.
example.egtrans: 这房子有五扇朝向街道的窗户。

example.eg: The detective tried to look at all the facts.
example.egtrans: 警探尝试了解所有事实。

example.eg: This article looks at similarities in the work of these two philosophers.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章检视了这两位哲学家作品上的相似之处。

example.eg: Ben decided that the past was behind him and that it was time to look to the future.
example.egtrans: 本决定将过去抛诸脑后，是时候展望未来了。

example.eg: Frank looked in the fridge to see if there was any milk.
example.egtrans: 弗兰克往冰箱里看，想知道还有没有牛奶。

dsense.name: look!
dsense.guideword: (used for drawing attention) (用来引起注意)

example.eg: Look! I think it's a UFO!
Who will look after the children while we're away?
Will you look after my fish while I'm away?
He's looking after his own interests, as usual.
Could you look after the shop for ten minutes while I run a few errands?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 照看, 照料, 管理

example.eg: When you are the driver, it's best to look ahead on the road.
example.egtrans: 你开车的时候，最好看着道路前方。

example.eg: The company is looking ahead to the future and hopes to expand its business.
example.egtrans: 公司正在展望未来，并期望拓展业务。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 展望未来, 为未来预作计划

dsense.name: look around for [sb/sth], also UK: look round for [sb/sth], look about for [sb/sth]

example.eg: I misplaced my keys, so I'll have to look around for them.
The little boy knew he was in trouble and when the teacher looked at him he had to look away.  It was a horror movie and I had to look away much of the time!
example.egtrans: 那个小男孩知道自己犯错了，当老师看向自己时，他只得避开老师的目光。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 避开…的目光, 不敢看

example.eg: When I look back, I wish I could live the days of my youth again.
example.egtrans: 当我回首往事，我希望能再过一回青春岁月。

example.eg: Rather than look back, I must remind myself to look towards the future to better days.
example.egtrans: 与其沉溺过往，我必须提醒自己要朝前看，展望美好的未来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 沉溺于过去, 缅怀过去

example.eg: I look back on my years in school and smile.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 回首, 回顾, 回忆

example.eg: Look beyond his looks; consider his personality.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看远一些, 往远处看, 展望未来

example.eg: Gary looked down in shame as the teacher told him off.
example.egtrans: 当老师训斥盖里时，他羞愧地低下了头。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 俯视, 向下看, 低下头

dsense.name: look down on [sb], look down upon [sb]

example.eg: It is wrong to look down on people less fortunate than yourself.

dsense.name: look down on [sth], look down upon [sth]

example.eg: These were rich girls who looked down on cheap clothes.
Some people look for love on the internet.  I looked for you, but I couldn't find you.
example.egtrans: 有些人在网上寻找真爱。我想找你，但是没找到。

example.eg: On New Year's Day, many of us like to look forward and think about the positive changes we can make over the coming year.
example.egtrans: 新年那一天，我们中的许多人喜欢展望未来，思考着自己来年能有什么积极向上的转变。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 展望未来, 看向前方

example.eg: We look forward to our summer holiday every year.
example.egtrans: 我们每年都期盼着暑假。

example.eg: I look forward to the day when I can afford to retire.
example.egtrans: 我期待着我能退休的一天。

example.eg: Fiona said she would look in to see if everything was OK.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 短暂看望, 简短拜访

example.eg: While I'm in town I should look in on my parents.
We are looking into ways of increasing our effectiveness.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 试图找到, 尝试找出

example.eg: The detective looked into the murder.  We have received your complaint, and we will look into it.
While my father taught me to swim, my mother looked on from the shore.

dsense.name: look on [sb] as [sth], look upon [sb] as [sth]

example.eg: I always looked upon him as a brother.
example.egtrans: 如果你从窗户朝外看，你就能看到一片汪洋。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…视为, 把…看成, 朝外看

example.eg: You must look out for snakes when walking in these hills.
example.egtrans: 走在这些小山上时，你须要提防蛇类。

example.eg: Jimmy's brothers have looked out for him since their parents died.
It was difficult to look past the unsightly mole on his face.
You can see the individual cells if you look through the microscope.  Look through the window and tell me what you see.
example.egtrans: 如果你透过显微镜，你就能看到一个个的细胞。透过窗户往外看，把你看到的告诉我。

dsense.name: look through [sth/sb]
dsense.guideword: figurative (appear not to see, be oblivious to) (比喻)

example.eg: I said hello but he looked right through me.
example.egtrans: 我向他打招呼，不过他目光穿我而过，似乎看不见我。

example.eg: Can I look through those old clothes before you throw them out in case there is something I like?  My boss looked through the papers before signing them.
example.egtrans: 在你扔掉之前，我能看一下那些旧衣服吗？里面或许有我喜欢的。在签署文件之前，我老板仔细翻阅了它们。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 翻阅遍，查阅遍, 浏览, 调查, 查找

example.eg: If you want to feel tiny, look up and see the stars at night.
Olivia gave her husband an angry look.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 仔细审视, 仔细研究
仔细审视…, 仔细研究…

example.eg: He gave her a dirty look when she testified against him.

dsense.name: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.

example.eg: I was disappointed that the antique vase my aunt gave me had a chip in the rim, but my mother said, "Don't look a gift horse in the mouth."
The exhibition offers a fresh look at Danish design.
Starlings feed in flocks and can clear bird tables before other species get a look-in.
These family photos are great. Have a look.
example.egtrans: 这些家庭照拍得太好了。快来看看。

example.eg: Let the doctor have a look at your rash.
example.egtrans: 让医生检查一下你的皮疹。

example.eg: You have the look of a woman in love!

dsense.name: I look forward to hearing from you
dsense.guideword: written, slightly formal (application, request: signing off) (申请、请求：落款，书面)

example.eg: Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

dsense.name: I look forward to your reply
dsense.guideword: written, slightly formal (application, request: signing off)

example.eg: Thank you for your consideration, and I look forward to your reply.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 期待您的回复, 期待收到您的答复

dsense.name: look a picture, be a picture

example.eg: She looked a picture on her wedding day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如画般美丽, 风景如画

example.eg: Adam and his brother look alike, don't you think?

dsense.name: look around, also UK: look round, look about

example.eg: I've been looking around everywhere, but I can't find my reading glasses.

dsense.name: look around [sth], also UK: look round [sth]

example.eg: Safety inspectors will be looking around the factory today.

dsense.name: look around, also UK: look round

example.eg: Sarah spent the afternoon looking around the local shops.
example.egtrans: 莎拉一下午都在四处浏览当地的商店。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 四处浏览, 四处看看

dsense.name: look askance at [sb/sth], look at [sb/sth] askance
look askance at [sb/sth], look at [sb/sth] askance

example.eg: Fancy restaurants look askance at shorts and sneakers.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从长远来看, 从宏观来看

example.eg: "Don't look back. Whatever's chasing you might be gaining on you." - Satchel Paige
example.egtrans: “别回头看。那样落在你后面的会赶上你的。”--萨奇·佩吉

example.eg: Darling, you look beautiful tonight.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看起来很漂亮, 外表漂亮

dsense.name: look before you leap
dsense.guideword: figurative (be aware of the risks involved in [sth]) (谚语)

example.eg: Thinking of investing in a new business? Look before you leap!
One should always look carefully at a document before signing it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 仔细查看, 仔细检查

example.eg: If you look closely, you will see the beautiful patterns on the butterfly's wings.
She looked closely at the gravestone and could just make out the faded inscription.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 仔细查看, 认真检查

dsense.name: look down on [sb/sth], look down upon [sb/sth]

example.eg: From the top of the tower you can look down upon the whole city.
We looked everywhere but we couldn't find it.
Darling, does this dress make me look fat?
He tried to sing a song at the karaoke bar while drunk and ended up looking foolish.
That looks fun.  May I join in?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看起来很有趣, 看起来很有意思

example.eg: Tina would look good if she smiled.  You're looking good tonight!
Those waves look good for surfers. That fish looks good!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看起来不错, 看起来挺诱人

example.eg: The project isn't finished yet, but it's looking good.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 进展不错, 情况不错, 直视, 正视, 看着…的眼睛

example.eg: Can you look me in the eye and tell me you didn't cheat on the test?
The fortune teller claimed she could look into the future.
This table looks like the one we have at home.  Lucy looks like her aunt.
example.egtrans: 这张桌子看起来像我们家的那张。

example.eg: It looks like we'll have to cancel our holiday.
example.egtrans: 看来我们得取消假期了。

example.eg: It's beginning to look like rain.
example.egtrans: 看起来似乎要下雨。

example.eg: His attempts to make the audience laugh at his crude jokes were met with looks of disapproval.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 快点，赶紧, 不赞成的表情

example.eg: The window looks on the meadow.

dsense.name: look on the bright side, look on the bright side of things

example.eg: If you always look on the bright side, you will be a much happier person.
example.egtrans: 如果你遇事多往好处看看，你就会快乐得多。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看光明面, 看有利的一面, 往好处看, 快速查看, 快速检查

example.eg: The inspector looked over the restaurant for code violations.
The jeweller gave the diamond a look-over and declared it genuine.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 粗查, 大致检查, 赶紧, 赶快

example.eg: Everyone looked sharp at the awards ceremony.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看起来很潮, 打扮得很时尚

example.eg: Take off that outrageous hat. You look silly!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 显得傻, 看起来傻里傻气的

example.eg: Don't just look to your right when you cross the street; look the other way as well.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看向另一边, 朝另一边看

example.eg: That judge looks the other way when members of his own staff commit minor crimes.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 故意看向另一边, 假装没看见

example.eg: I don't know if John is prepared for the performance, but he certainly looks the part.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看上去像回事，看上去像模像样

example.eg: Unsure what to do, Sue looked to Mark, who was seated to her left.
example.egtrans: 不知所措的苏看向坐在自己左边的马克。

example.eg: Children look to their parents for guidance.
example.egtrans: 孩子们指望父母的指导。

example.eg: I'm not looking to buy a set of encyclopedias right now.
example.egtrans: 我现在并不想要一整套的百科全书。

example.eg: That couch looks to be about 50 years old.
